qas.question: What variety has there been in the materials of clothing throughout history?
What is an article that is carried rather than worn that isn't regarded as clothing?
Jewelry isn't considered clothing because it's usually worn purely for what reason?
What are footwear and hats both considered?
What is an example of something that serves a function other than protection?
There has been little variety in materials used for what?
All what is regarded as clothing?
What article of clothing is carried rather than worn?
Jewelry is usually consider clothing because his worn for what reason?
Footwear and hats are consider clothing rather than what?

context: <b5_0>Clothing<b5_0/> can and has in history been made from a <a0_0>very wide<a0_0/> variety of materials. Materials have ranged from leather and furs, to woven materials, to elaborate and exotic natural and synthetic fabrics. Not all <b6_0>body coverings<b6_0/> are regarded as clothing. Articles carried rather than worn (such as <a1_0><b7_0>purses<b7_0/><a1_0/>), worn on a single part of the body and easily removed (scarves), worn purely for <a2_0><b8_0>adornment<b8_0/><a2_0/> (jewelry), or those that serve a function other than protection (<a4_0>eyeglasses<a4_0/>), are normally considered <a3_0><b9_0>accessories<b9_0/><a3_0/> rather than clothing, as are footwear and hats.
